citation: Morée, A., Schwinger, J., Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research, Geophysical Institute, University of Bergen, NORCE Norwegian Research Centre (2019).PMIP3-based Last Glacial Maximum (LGM) pre-industrial (PI) anomaly fields for addition to PI ocean model forcing, version 2 [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00019
description: Data optimized for use as ocean modeling forcing fields for last glacial maximum time-slice modelling based on PMIP3 output. The data includes specific humidity, downwelling longwave and shortwave radiation, precipitation, wind (v and u components), temperature and sea surface salinity (SSS). It is based on the difference between the piControl and lgm runs of PMIP3 models CNRM-CM5, IPSL-CM5A-LR, MIROC-ESM, GISS-E2-R and MRI-CGCM3. The data are annual data provided on a Gaussian 192×94 (lon×lat) grid (except for sea surface salinity, which is provided on a regular 1×1 degree grid) and presented such that regridding or other adjustments should be straightforward with NetCDF toolkits such as CDO or NCO. This is a newer version of LINK. The .md5 files contain the checksum of the .nc files of the same name.
name: PMIP3-based Last Glacial Maximum (LGM) pre-industrial (PI) anomaly fields for addition to PI ocean model forcing, version 2

citation: Brenna, H., Krüger, K., Kutterolf, S. (2019).Simulations for paper "Global ozone depletion and increase of UV radiation caused by pre-industrial tropical volcanic eruptions" [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00013
description: README Author: Hans Brenna E-mail: LINK E_mail: LINK This dataset contains the simulations for our paper "Global ozone depletion and increase of UV radiation caused by pre-industrial tropical volcanic eruptions". All the simulation data are included in this dataset. The data consists of NetCDF files containing output from the climate model CESM1(WACCM) as described in our article. Briefly: Included are 3 ensembles, each containing 8 simulations, a control simulation and 2 sensitvity simulations. The naming conventions are as follows: cesmCompSet.experiment.(branchyear+memberNumber) The first element of the case names is the same in all cases (f1850w) which means that all simulations were carried out using the CESM1 component set F1850W 1) Control simulation case name: new_control 2) Full forcing ensemble case name: aCAVA_full 3) Halogen forcing ensemble case name: aCAVA 4) SAD forcing ensemble case name: aCAVA_SAD 5) Full (1% halogen injection) case name: aCAVA_full_1pc 6) Control simulation with increased natural halogen background case name: scen_nat_hal2
name: Simulations for paper "Global ozone depletion and increase of UV radiation caused by pre-industrial tropical volcanic eruptions"
rights holder: Department of Geosciences, University of Oslo (IG-UIO)

Creator: Anne Morée
Jörg Schwinger
Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research (BCCR)
Geophysical Institute, University of Bergen (GFI/UiB)
NORCE Norwegian Research Centre (NORCE)
citation: Morée, A., Schwinger, J., Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research, Geophysical Institute, University of Bergen, NORCE Norwegian Research Centre (2019).Last Glacial Maximum minus  pre-industrial anomaly fields for use in forced ocean modelling, based  on PMIP3 [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00011
description: Anomaly data for use in forced ocean modelling of the Last Glacial Maximum, as based on PMIP3 output. The data includes specific humidity, downwelling longwave and shortwave radiation, precipitation, wind (v and u components), temperature and sea surface salinity (SSS). It is based on the difference between the piControl and lgm runs of PMIP3 models CNRM-CM5, IPSL-CM5A-LR, MIROC-ESM and MRI-CGCM3. The data are annual data provided in netCDF files on a Gaussian 192×94 (lon×lat) grid and presented such that regridding or other adjustments should be straightforward with packages such as CDO or NCO.
name: Last Glacial Maximum minus  pre-industrial anomaly fields for use in forced ocean modelling, based  on PMIP3

Creator: Ingo Bethke
citation: Bethke, I. (2019).NorESM HAPPI output – All-Hist/Long raw [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00010
description: Dataset contains raw output from historical All-Hist simulations produced with NorESM1-HAPPI (Iversen et al. 2017) for the half a degree additional warming, prognosis and projected impacts (HAPPI) project (Mitchell et al. 2017, LINK). Members 001-125 cover the “present decade” period 2006-2016. From mid-2016, SST boundary conditions are repeated from year 2015. Members 101-125 contain extra high-frequent output for dynamical downscaling. Members 126-135 cover the longer historical period 1959-2016. Their output is intended for calibration purpose. No volcanic forcing is used during the historical period. References: Mitchell, D., AchutaRao, K., Allen, M., Bethke, I., Beyerle, U., Ciavarella, A., Forster, P. M., Fuglestvedt, J., Gillett, N., Haustein, K., Ingram, W., Iversen, T., Kharin, V., Klingaman, N., Massey, N., Fischer, E., Schleussner, C.-F., Scinocca, J., Seland, Ø., Shiogama, H., Shuckburgh, E., Sparrow, S., Stone, D., Uhe, P., Wallom, D., Wehner, M., and Zaaboul, R.: Half a degree additional warming, prognosis and projected impacts (HAPPI): background and experimental design, Geosci. name: NorESM HAPPI output – All-Hist/Long raw

Creator: Moa Sporre
citation: Sporre, M. (2019).BVOC-aerosol-climate feedbacks - simulation data from NorESM [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00008
description:
NorESM simulation data from the 9 simulations that was used in the publication. The data is temporally averaged over the 6 years that was used in the investigation in order to reduce the size of the data. Both data from the atmospheric model CAM-Oslo and the land model CLM is provided.

name: BVOC-aerosol-climate feedbacks - simulation data from NorESM

Creator: Ingo Bethke
citation: Bethke, I. (2019).NorESM HAPPI output – All-Hist raw [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00006
description: Dataset contains raw output from historical All-Hist simulations produced with NorESM1-HAPPI (Iversen et al. 2017) for the half a degree additional warming, prognosis and projected impacts (HAPPI) project (Mitchell et al. 2017, LINK). Members 001-125 cover the “present decade” period 2006-2016. From mid-2016, SST boundary conditions are repeated from year 2015. References: Mitchell, D., AchutaRao, K., Allen, M., Bethke, I., Beyerle, U., Ciavarella, A., Forster, P. M., Fuglestvedt, J., Gillett, N., Haustein, K., Ingram, W., Iversen, T., Kharin, V., Klingaman, N., Massey, N., Fischer, E., Schleussner, C.-F., Scinocca, J., Seland, Ø., Shiogama, H., Shuckburgh, E., Sparrow, S., Stone, D., Uhe, P., Wallom, D., Wehner, M., and Zaaboul, R.: Half a degree additional warming, prognosis and projected impacts (HAPPI): background and experimental design, Geosci. Model Dev., 10, 571-583, LINK, 2017. Iversen, T., Bethke, I., Debernard, J. B., Graff, L. S., Seland, Ø., Bentsen, M., Kirkevåg, A., Li, C., and Olivié, D. J. L.: The NorESM1-Happi used for evaluating differences between a global warming of 1.5°C and 2°C, and the role of Arctic Amplification, Earth Syst. Dynam. Discuss., LINK, in review, 2017. Creator: Ingo Bethke
citation: Bethke, I. (2019).NorESM HAPPI output – Plus20-Future raw [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00003
description: Dataset contains raw output from Plus20-Future simulations produced with NorESM1-HAPPI (Iversen et al. 2017) for the half a degree additional warming, prognosis and projected impacts HAPPI project (Mitchell et al. 2017, LINK). References: Mitchell, D., AchutaRao, K., Allen, M., Bethke, I., Beyerle, U., Ciavarella, A., Forster, P. M., Fuglestvedt, J., Gillett, N., Haustein, K., Ingram, W., Iversen, T., Kharin, V., Klingaman, N., Massey, N., Fischer, E., Schleussner, C.-F., Scinocca, J., Seland, Ø., Shiogama, H., Shuckburgh, E., Sparrow, S., Stone, D., Uhe, P., Wallom, D., Wehner, M., and Zaaboul, R.: Half a degree additional warming, prognosis and projected impacts (HAPPI): background and experimental design, Geosci. Model Dev., 10, 571-583, LINK, 2017. Iversen, T., Bethke, I., Debernard, J. B., Graff, L. S., Seland, Ø., Bentsen, M., Kirkevåg, A., Li, C., and Olivié, D. J. L.: The NorESM1-Happi used for evaluating differences between a global warming of 1.5°C and 2°C, and the role of Arctic Amplification, Earth Syst. Dynam. Discuss., LINK, in review, 2017. citation: Schwinger, J., Tjiputra, J., Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research, Uni Research Climate (2018).Biogeochemically coupled, 1% CO₂ ramp-down simulation starting from the end of year 140 of the CMIP5 1% ramp-up simulation, including a 60 year extension at constant preindustrial CO₂ [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2018.00009
description: This data set consists of two simulations conducted with the Norwegian Earth System Model. These are an extension of the CMIP5 biogeochemically coupled 1% CO₂ ramp-up (esmFixClim1), simulating a biogeochemically coupled 1% CO₂ ramp-down until preindustrial CO₂ concentrations are reached plus a 60 year extension at constant CO₂ levels. The model version is the same as used for CMIP5 and is documented in Tjiputra et al. 2013. For further information, please contact (jorg DOT schwinger AT uni DOT no) or (jerry DOT tjiputra AT uni DOT no).
name: Biogeochemically coupled, 1% CO₂ ramp-down simulation starting from the end of year 140 of the CMIP5 1% ramp-up simulation, including a 60 year extension at constant preindustrial CO₂

The model version is the same as used for CMIP5 and is documented in Tjiputra et al. 2013. citation: Keenlyside, N., Shen, M., Counillon, F., Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research, Geophysical Institute, University of Bergen, Devilliers, M. (2017).Supermodelling with Noresm-bccrfast, EC-Earth and Mpi-Esm [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2017.00022
description:
We are running 3 global climate models:  EC-Earth3.2beta version, with the resolution T255 for the atmosphere and ORCA1L75 for the ocean, NorESM bccrfast, with the compset NBF20TREXT and MPIESM with the resolution T63G15t2. The period is 1980-2000, we apply some forcing during the simulation. We run the models separatly in the experience "Reference_30y" and then we combine them assimilating the SST with the ENOI method at the end of each month in the experience "Super_20y".

Creator: Johanne H.  Rydsaa
citation: Rydsaa, J. H. (2017).Effects of shrub cover increase on the near surface atmosphere in northern Fennoscandia [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2017.00013
description: The dataset is produced using the WRF model with the NOAH lad suface model to investigate the effects of shrub expansion on the near surface atmosphere in northern Fennoscandia. The data consist of a reference simulation and two simulations where the shrub cover has been perturbed/expanded. The simulations are further described in the paper (DOI: LINK). The data consists of the WRF output used for analysis int he paper.
name: Effects of shrub cover increase on the near surface atmosphere in northern Fennoscandia

description: Forcing for the Surfex/Crocus snowpack simulation. This data set has two large snow events, and a sun crust should form between the events.
name: Simulated data set (neverland)

Creator: Diako Darian
citation: Darian, D. (2017).EMSES - Plasma-rocket simulations [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2017.00008
description: Dataset from plasma-rocket simulations using the EMSES-code. The data contain four different quantities; electric potential, rocket's floating potential, plasma densities, and particle influx onto to the rocket's surface. influxXYdeg: contains the particle influx onto the rocket surface for the case with Mach-number X and magnetic field angle of Y degrees. pbodyXYdeg contains the rocket's floating potential for the case with Mach-number X and magnetic field angle of Y degrees. phispMXYdeg.h5 contains the electric potential around the rocket for the case with Mach-number X and magnetic field angle of Y degrees. rhoeMXYdeg.h5 contains the electron density around the rocket for the case with Mach-number X and magnetic field angle of Y degrees. rhoiMXYdeg.h5 contains the ion density around the rocket for the case with Mach-number X and magnetic field angle of Y degrees. The magnetic field angle refers to the angle between the magnetic field and the rocket's axis. Details about the EMSES code and its documentation can be found in: "Miyake, Y. & Usui, H. (2009), New electromagnetic particle simulation code for the analysis of spacecraft-plasma interactions. Phys. Plasmas, 16 (6), pp. 062904. doi: LINK.3147922"
name: EMSES - Plasma-rocket simulations

Creator: Kjersti Daae
Tore Hattermann
Elin Darelius
Ilker Fer
Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research (BCCR)

citation: Daae, K., Hattermann, T., Darelius, E., Fer, I., Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research, Geophysical Institute, University of Bergen, Akvaplan-niva, Trømsø (2017).The idealized Weddell Sea continental shelf model [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2017.00003
description: Regional Ocean Model System (ROMS) netCDF format. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XE6 in Bergen (hexagon). Model source: ROMS version 3.6. Model domain: 1500km x 500km. Horizontal resolution: 1500 X 1500 m. Vertical resolution: 30 terrain-following layers with enhanced resolution near the surface and near the sea bed. The layer thickness varies from less than 3 m in the surface layer over the continental shelf up to 110 m in the deep ocean interior. Output frequency: daily. These files comprise model output from model year 5, when the simulation is close to stable state.

Creator: Ingo Bethke
Stephen Outten
Peter Thorne
citation: Bethke, I., Outten, S., Thorne, P. (2017).NorESM output prepared for VOLCANOES4FUTURE - NO-VOLC reference experiment [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2017.00002
description:
This dataset contains climate model output that has been prepared for the internal Bjerknes Centre project VOLCANOES4FUTURE which aimed to assess the impact of potential volcanic activity on future climate projections. 

The control experiment comprises of 60 simulations that cover the period 1980 to 2099 and follow the CMIP5 historical+rcp4.5 forcing protocol. In particular, no volcanic forcing was applied after year 2005 in this experiment. The simulations were spawned from NorESM’s CMIP5 historical simulations [Bentsen et al. 2012]. Initial spread within the 20-member subsets was generated by adding artificial noise to the ocean mixed layer temperatures.
 
The data contains monthly atmospheric, ocean, land and sea ice output stored in NetCDF format. The data contains basic in-file metadata providing information like variable names and units as well as temporal and spatial information. Additional grid information is stored in a separate grid folder. 

For more detailed information please contact the dataset creators.

citation: Langebroek , P.,  Nisancioglu, K., Department of Earth Science, University of Bergen, Bjerknes Centre for Climate Research, Uni Research Climate (2016).Norwegian Earth System Model (low resolution) Last Interglacial, 130ka simulation [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2016.00013
description: Norwegian Earth System Model (low resolution). netcdf 3 format. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XE6 in Bergen (hexagon). Model source: projects EU FP7 project Past4Future and BCCR SKD project DYNAWARM. Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM4; sea ice=CICE4; coupler=CLP7. Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=3.75x3.75 degree; ocean/sea ice=~3 degree. Output frequency: monthly. LIG simulations branch off from PI simulation at model year 495. All simulations use modern land-sea distribution, topography and bathymetry, ice sheets and vegetation. Four LIG simulations are forced by fixed PI GHG, and orbital parameters corresponding to 115 ka, 120 ka, 125 ka and 130 ka (suffix Gpi). Two LIG simulations are forced by lower GHG levels as set by PMIP3, and orbital parameters corresponding to 125 ka and 130 ka. No other forcings, or changes in boundary conditions. All LIG simulations ran another 505 yrs. These files comprise model output from model year 901-1000, when the simulations are close to equilibrium.

Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=3.75x3.75 degree; ocean/sea ice=~3 degree. Output frequency: monthly. Use: PI simulation (N1950), only atm&ocn files saved; simulation uses modern land-sea distribution, topography and bathymetry, ice sheets and vegetation. These files comprise model output from model year 901-1000, when the simulation is close to equilibrium.

description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP8.5 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCNOC_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP85AERCNOC_f19_g16_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP2.6 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from historical simulation r1 [N20TRAERCNOC_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP26AERCNOC_f19_g16_01;NRCP26AERCNOC_f19_g16_02; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP6 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCNOC_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP60AERCNOC_f19_g16_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP4.5 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCNOC_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP45AERCNOC_f19_g16_02; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 esmrcp85 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from esmHistorical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCNOCBPRP_f19_g16_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG emissions; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP85AERBPRP_f19_g16_03; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 esmFdbk1 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from piControl spin-up (N1850AERCNOC_f19_g16_03) at 901-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N1850RMAERCNOC_f19_g16_RAD_02; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 esmFixClim1 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from piControl spin-up (N1850AERCNOC_f19_g16_03) at 901-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N1850RMAERCNOC_f19_g16_BGC_02; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 esmHistorical experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from esmControl (N1850AERBPRP_f19_g16_02) at 1051-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG emissions; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N20TRAERCNOCBPRP_f19_g16_01 ; Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2015).NorESM1-ME CMIP5 historical  (3.2) r1 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2015.00021
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 piControl simulation (N1850AERCNOC_f19_g16_CTRL_02) at 901-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N20TRAERCNOC_01; Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from piControl spin-up (N1850AERCNOC_f19_g16_03) at 901-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG emissions; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N1850AERBPRP_f19_g16_02 ; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 1 percent per year CO2 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 144 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: Initial conditions are from experiment 3.1 piControl NorESM1-ME Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.9005 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N1850RMAERCNOC_f19_g16_02; Creator: Norwegian Meteorological Institute (MET Norway)
Institute of Marine Research (IMR)
citation: Norwegian Meteorological Institute, Institute of Marine Research (2015).SVIM ocean hindcast archive [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2015.00014
description: The dataset contains results from a 54 year (1958-2011) numerical ocean model hindcast archive, produced with the Regional Ocean Modeling System (ROMS; LINK). ROMS is a three dimensional baroclinic ocean general circulation model which uses topography-following s-coordinates in the vertical. This ensures high vertical resolution in shallow areas such as shelf seas and coastal areas. Here, the model is run on a grid with 32 s-layers in the vertical. In the horizontal, the grid resolution is 4 km and covers the Nordic, Barents and Kara seas, as well as parts of the Arctic Ocean.
name: SVIM ocean hindcast archive

Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)

description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical simulation but with GHG forcing only. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: Initial conditions are from experiment 3.1 piControl Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N20TRAERCNGHG_f19_g16_01, NRCP85AERCNGHG_f19_g16_01 ; Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2015).NorESM1-M CMIP5 rcp45 (4.1) r1 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2015.00012
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP4.5 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2015).NorESM1-M CMIP5 sst2030 (2.1) r1 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2015.00006
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 2030 time-slice experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 RCP4.5 simulation r1 (NRCP45AERCN_f19_g16_01) at 2026-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NFRCP45_2026-2035_f19_f19; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 other historical forcing experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: initial conditions obtained from beginning of CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) Changing forcing agents: aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N20TRAERCNAER_f19_g16_01, NRCP85AERCNAER_f19_g16_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical simulation but with natural forcing only. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: Initial conditions are from experiment 3.1 piControl Changing forcing agents: none (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N20TRAERCNNAT_f19_g16_01, NRCP85AERCNNAT_f19_g16_01 ; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP6 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP60AERCN_f19_g16_01; Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2015).NorESM1-M CMIP5 rcp26 (4.3) r1 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2015.00004
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP2.6 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP26AERCN_f19_g16_01 ; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 CO2 forcing experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: initial conditions obtained from beginning of CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NF18504XAERCNAMIPC_f19_f19_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 4xCO2 AMIP experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_01) at 1979-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NF20054XAERAMIPO_f19_f19_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 all aerosol forcing experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: intitial conditions obtained from beginning of CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) Changing forcing agents: aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NF1850AER20CNAMIPC_f19_f19_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical extension experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) at 730-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP85AERCN_f19_g16_03; Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2014).NorESM1-M CMIP5 rcp85 (4.2) r1 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2014.00016
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 RCP8.5 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 historical simulation r1 (N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_01) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NRCP85AERCN_f19_g16_01; name: NorESM1-M CMIP5 rcp85 (4.2) r1 raw output

Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2014).NorESM1-M CMIP5 historical (3.2) r3 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2014.00015
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) at 760-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_03; citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2014).NorESM1-M CMIP5 amip (3.2) r2 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2014.00013
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 amip experiment Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: Initial conditions are from year 1979 of experiment 3.2 historical. Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NFAMIP2005AERAMIPO_f19_f19_02; name: NorESM1-M CMIP5 amip (3.2) r3 raw output

Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)
citation: Norwegian Climate Center (2014).NorESM1-M CMIP5 amip (3.2) r1 raw output [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2014.00014
description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 amip experiment Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: Initial conditions are from year 1979 of experiment 3.2 historical. Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = NFAMIP2005AERAMIPO_f19_f19_01,NFAMIP2008AERAMIPO_f19_f19_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 abrupt 4XCO2 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 a January in experiment 3.1_piControl Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N18504XAERCN_f19_g16_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 1 percent per year CO2 experiment. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: Initial conditions are from experiment 3.1 piControl Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) Data description: case = N1850RMAERCN_f19_g16_01; B., Iversen, T., Kirkevåg, A., Seland, Ø., Drange, H., Roelandt, C., Seierstad, I. A., Hoose, C., and Kristjánsson, J. E.: The Norwegian Earth System Model, NorESM1-M – Part 1: Description and basic evaluation of the physical climate, Geosci. Model Dev., 6, 687-720, doi:10.5194/gmd-6-687-2013, 2013. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) at 700-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) LINK (link to national publication database) Data description: case = N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_01; description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical extension experiment with forcing scenario RCP8.5. Citation: Bentsen, M., Bethke, I., Debernard, J. B., Iversen, T., Kirkevåg, A., Seland, Ø., Drange, H., Roelandt, C., Seierstad, I. A., Hoose, C., and Kristjánsson, J. E.: The Norwegian Earth System Model, NorESM1-M – Part 1: Description and basic evaluation of the physical climate, Geosci. Model Dev., 6, 687-720, doi:10.5194/gmd-6-687-2013, 2013. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 historical simulation r2 (N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_02) at 2006-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) LINK (link to national publication database) Data description: case = NRCP85AERCN_f19_g16_02; Creator: Norwegian Climate Center (NCC)

description: Norwegian Earth System Model version 1 (medium resolution) output prepared for the CMIP5 historical experiment. Citation: Bentsen, M., Bethke, I., Debernard, J. B., Iversen, T., Kirkevåg, A., Seland, Ø., Drange, H., Roelandt, C., Seierstad, I. A., Hoose, C., and Kristjánsson, J. E.: The Norwegian Earth System Model, NorESM1-M – Part 1: Description and basic evaluation of the physical climate, Geosci. Model Dev., 6, 687-720, doi:10.5194/gmd-6-687-2013, 2013. Technical details: Production machine: Cray XT3 in Bergen (hexagon) Model source: LINK Model revision number: 112 Model components: atmosphere=CAM4; ocean=MICOM; land=CLM; sea ice=CICE Horizontal resolution: atmosphere/land=1.9x2.5 degree; ocean/sea ice=~1 degree Output frequency: monthly + daily + 6-hourly + 3-hourly as requested by CMIP5 Experiment type: fully coupled Initialisation: branched from CMIP5 piControl simulation r1 (NAER1850CNOC_f19_g16_06) at 730-01-01 Changing forcing agents: prescribed GHG concentration changes; aerosol emissions for SO4, POM and BC (see Kirkevåg et al. 2013) Tuning parameters changed relative to the host model CAM4: rhminl=0.90 (0.91 in CAM4) reduced RH threshold for formation of low stratiform clouds; critrp=5.0 mm/day (0.5 mm/day in CAM4) maximum precipitation rate for suppression of autoconversion of cloud water; r3lc=14 um (10 um in CAM4) critical mean droplet volume radius for onset of autoconversion Other comments: - External references: LINK (experimental design) LINK (model system, boundary conditions, experiments, etc) LINK (Norwegian ESGF portal with post-processed CMIP5 data) LINK (NorESM special issue) LINK (link to national publication database) Data description: case = N20TRAERCN_f19_g16_02; Creator: Department of Geosciences, University of Oslo (IG-UIO)
citation: Department of Geosciences, University of Oslo, Department of Geosciences, University of Oslo ( ? ).Permafrost distribution in steep slopes in Norway [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2019.00026
description: Permafrost in steep slopes has been increasingly studied since the early 2000s in conjunction with a growing number of rock-slope failures, which likely resulted from permafrost degradation. In Norway, rock-slope destabilization is a widespread phenomenon and a major source of risk for the population and infrastructure. However, the lack of precise understanding of the permafrost distribution in steep slopes hinders the assessment of its role in these destabilizations. This study proposes the first nation-wide permafrost probability map for the steep slopes of Norway (CryoWall map). It is based on a multiple linear regression model fitted with multi-annual rock surface temperature (RST) measurements, collected at 25 rock-wall sites, spread across a latitudinal transect (59–69° N) over mainland Norway. The CryoWall map suggests that discontinuous permafrost widely occurs above 1300–1400 and 1600–1700 m a.s.l. in the north and south slopes of southern Norway (59° N), respectively. This lower altitudinal limit decreases in northern Norway (70° N) by about 500 ± 50 m, with more pronounced decrease for south faces, in reason of the insolation patterns largely driven by midnight sun in summer and polar night in winter. Similarly, the mean annual RST differences between north and south faces of similar elevation range around 1.5 °C in northern Norway and 3.5 °C in southern Norway. The CryoWall map is evaluated against direct ice observations in steep slopes and discussed in the context of former permafrost studies in various types of terrains in Norway. We show that permafrost can occur at much lower elevations in steep rock slopes than in other terrains, especially in north faces. We demonstrate that the CryoWall map is a valuable basis for further investigations related to permafrost in steep slopes in both practical concerns and fundamental science.
name: Permafrost distribution in steep slopes in Norway
rights holder: Department of Geosciences, University of Oslo (IG-UIO)

Creator: Nico Reissmann
citation: Reissmann, N. (2014).A Study of Energy and Locality Effects using Space-filling Curves [Data set]. Norstore. https://doi.org/10.11582/2014.00009
description: The cost of energy is becoming an increasingly important driver for the operating cost of HPC systems, adding yet another facet to the challenge of producing efficient code. In this paper, we investigate the energy implications of trading computation for locality using Hilbert and Morton space-filling curves with dense matrix-matrix multiplication. The advantage of these curves is that they exhibit an inherent tiling effect without requiring specific architecture tuning. By accessing the matrices in the order determined by the space-filling curves, we can trade computation for locality. The index computation overhead of the Morton curve is found to be balanced against its locality and energy efficiency, while the overhead of the Hilbert curve outweighs its improvements on our test system.
name: A Study of Energy and Locality Effects using Space-filling Curves
